intro: Agalinis obtusifolia, commonly known as the bluntleaf false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes several parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple, with two lips that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is short-lived, often completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
